newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Applied Materials firms.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Applied Materials firms.

text.p: Applied Materials Inc stock rose to 62-1/2 preceding Wednesday's market open from 60-7/16 at last night's Nasdaq close after the company reported better-than-expected earnings.

Minutes after Tuesday's close, Applied said it earned $0.54 per share in the fiscal second quarter ended April 27, under the $1.01 post one year ago but $0.04 better than Wall Street's consensus expectation.
Applied Materials shares rallied in after-hours activity immediately following its earnings release.
Micron Electronics Inc shares remained weaker in early third market activity, falling to 16-3/4 from last night's 18-5/8 Nasdaq close.

During yesterday's regular Nasdaq session, the shares fell 5-3/8 on market worries about the company's upcoming third quarter results, a negative confirmed by the company in a statement released after the market close.
Micron Electronics said the results are likely to be hurt by recent price reductions in personal computer systems and higher start-up costs overseas.
Aurum Software Inc traded at 19 preceding the market open, up 1-7/8, after Baan Co said Tuesday it reached a definitive agreement to acquire Aurum in a $250 stock deal.
The deal is valued at $21 per Aurum share based on stock prices as of the May 9 market close, Baan said.
